#Text=44 dead and over 300,000 homeless after flooding in Brazil
#Text=Tuesday , May 12 , 2009
#Text=Floods affecting five states in northeastern Brazil have left hundreds of thousands homeless and have taken 44 lives .

#Text=Heavy rainfall which began in early April has caused overland flooding that has destroyed homes in the region and landslides that have blocked roads , including 6 major highways , and a railway .
#Text=Stock photo : Thunderstorms over Brazil
#Text=The Associated Press reports that over 300,000 are homeless in north eastern Brazil , and CNN states 270 communities have been affected by overland water from flooded rivers .
#Text=This flood has been the worst to strike the area since the 1950s and officials estimate damages at one billion reais ( about US$ 482 million ) .
#Text=Civil defence authorities placed the homeless figure at about 185,000 as of Saturday .
#Text=Emergency shelters have taken in some of the homeless , and friends and relatives have opened their doors to others who have been forced from their homes .
#Text=The five states affected the greatest by the 2009 Brazil flood highlighted in blue
#Text=Maranhão has been hit the hardest , and has lost nine residents , two due to electrocution .
#Text=The state has declared a state of emergency as over 40,000 are homeless and without water .
#Text=A canoe with seven people aboard capsized .
#Text=Police and firefighting officials are searching for two who are still missing .
#Text=Twelve deaths have been reported in the state of Ceará .
#Text=Bahia on the Atlantic coast has suffered seven fatalities .
#Text=The state of Amazonas has lost eight people so far .
#Text=The Rio Negro , the largest tributary of the Amazon , has been rising .
#Text=Piauí is suffering from two swollen rivers , no electricity due to power failures , and no potable water .
#Text=The Brazilian government began to send food via military cargo planes on Friday .
#Text=The government has also sent out rice and beans by boat and helicopter to a few places .
#Text=Officials verify that they are sending out as much aid as possible .
#Text=Land slides combined with overland waters have washed out roads are making deliveries challenging .
#Text=Emergency flood crews are struggling to open roads and pathways for food , supplies and aid .
#Text=File : Itajai floods . jpg
#Text=2008
#Text=Santa Catarina Floods ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=" We have to go out and find food because almost nothing 's arrived here , " said a victim helping out in an emergency shelter .
#Text=Homeless people huddled together by the thousands in tents and cow pens are fishing and leaving by canoe to find food .

#Text=Besides drowning , electrocution is also taking victims . rattlesnakes and anacondas , and alligators are also displaced and are swimming through partially submerged communities in the swollen waters .
#Text=This northeastern region of Brazil typically endures drought-like conditions . meteorologists are baffled by the deluge of rain which hit the area for the past fourteen days .
#Text=Precipitation is estimated to continue for another week and half .
